title: Graphic artifacts on videos and frequent tab crashes
content:
Hello,

I've been getting an error for some time now. Firefox tabs suddenly crash (usually media tabs with video, like Twitch or video conference sites) and I can't seem to find a solution. But most importantly, many videos or live streams show graphic artifacts. You can check it in the attached screenshot). I have tried many things to solve it, but none worked. This is what I tried:

  • Changing cables and monitors.
  • Disabling extensions and plugins.
  • Disabling hardware acceleration.
  • Installing Firefox from scratch.
  • Installing an old version.
  • Installing Nightly.
  • Removing the GPU. The issue persisted with a different video card and with integrated graphics. So the GPU is not the issue.
  • Trying using another OS. I thought my Windows install might have been corrupt, but it also happened in Ubuntu.
  • Trying other browsers. I tried Chrome (which resulted in the issue as well) and Edge (which surprisingly did fine, it's my only solution right now).

I would love to keep using Firefox but it's a pain to watch media like this. I don't know if the issue might be from the motherboard or another component. Between the crashes and this I can't use it normally.

I can try providing any details needed to solve the problem. Could you please help me? I don't know what else I can try.
creator: orphenkirisame

title: Mozila does not save new passwords
content: Mozila does not save new (changed) passwords. I change the password on the site, she offers to replace the existing one, I agree and save, and she asks this several times in a row, but when entering the site, the form is filled with old data! Perhaps this is some option that I accidentally enabled? Still installed "Spy bot& Destroy", but there were no problems with it before. But I turned on the control of profiles there (I will attach a picture). Maybe he does not allow changing saved passwords? Although I kind of turned off the control of cookies in it. I just got into the settings of Mozila and Spy in the same day and after that various problems with the browser started. Checked for viruses several times, clean.

title: Find actually used proxy when configured to "Use System Proxy Settings"
content:
The configuration on page General - Connection Settings is set to Use System Proxy Settings. How can I find out I which proxy my Firefox browser is actually using?

Note: This very question has already been asked at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1208062. It has an answer which is marked as Chosen Solution although the question owner explicitly stated it doesn't answer the question, and indeed it doesn't because it just says to look at the configuration page which doesn't contain the information. That thread has been archived. Perhaps it should be deleted or at least the Chosen Solution mark removed.
creator: tilman.schmidt

title: Firefox suddenly not loading - have done all the trouble shooting item - now what?
content: Windows 10, Lenovo Yoga C940, Firefox working great. Tried to load a new adobe package (which failed), then searched on a couple sites then bam - since then Firefox hangs, does not even start to load. No clue what happened! What I have done to try and solve -reboot several times, Restart in safe mode, refreshed, uninstall and re-installed, turn off firewall options as instructed, Scanned entire system for Malware (Norton 360), Cleared Cached and cookies, removed Patent Lock file. Before I remove Firefox totally and move to Chrome can anyone help? I have used Firefox for over 7 years - I don't what to move on. I looked at troubleshooting on firefox and it states Launch Process - Disabled due to Failure. Google answers to this point to things I have already done. webrender-software denied by env: not on allowlist
creator: cindykanwar
